unnormalised: Film Festivals: Lights, Camera, AND Samosas!
normalised: Hey folks! So, you know how much we all love a good movie, right? But have you ever thought about where all those amazing indie flicks or thought provoking documentaries actually come from? Often, it is film festivals!

unnormalised: Hey folks! So, you know how much we all love a good movie, right? But have you ever thought about where all those amazing indie flicks or thought-provoking documentaries actually *come* from? Often, it's film festivals!
normalised: These aren't just red carpets and fancy clothes (though there's plenty of that too!). They are a breeding ground for creativity, a place where emerging filmmakers can showcase their work, and where viewers like us get to discover hidden gems. Think of it like a huge celebration of storytelling through cinema.

normalised: India has its own amazing roster of festivals. The International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa is a big one, held annually, and it's a proper feast for the eyes. Then there's the Jio M A M I Mumbai Film Festival, which is a hub for both Bollywood and independent cinema – you might even spot a star or two from a Dharma Productions film there!

normalised: Why should you check one out? Well, imagine being among the first to see a film that goes on to win awards, or chatting with the director over a cup of chai! Plus, you'll get to watch movies you'd probably never find in your local P V R. It's like uncovering a treasure chest of cinematic goodness.

normalised: I remember going to a small regional film festival in Kerala a couple of years back, and I saw this documentary about the fishermen there – absolutely blew my mind! Cost me like rupee fifty for a day pass, total bargain! Seriously, it was way better than spending rupee five hundred on a popcorn bucket at a regular cinema.

normalised: Whether it's a massive event like I F F I or a smaller, more intimate gathering, film festivals offer a unique opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of cinema. You get to see films from all corners of the globe, meet interesting people, and maybe even discover your new favorite filmmaker.
